page.title: 09Religion. Local history.
page.content: {Leighton Church.} We often visit Holy Trinity Church and sometimes take part in special sevices. The owner of Leighton Hall, John Naylor, had it built in 1851. It is a beautiful church,built of Cefn sandstone. It has a tall spire which is a landmark in the area. There are buttresses supporting the walls and high roof outside, and stained-glass windows and carvings inside. Thereis a small chapel to the right of the pulpit, which contains memorials to all the Naylor family. The central sculptured figure of an angel is the work of Georgiana Naylor. Although in Wales, it is in the Diocese of Hereford.
